comments.raw_text:
there's no visual representation of cite attribute, it's exposed via DOM HTMLQuoteElement interface only. 

It sounds it's reasonable to expose HyperLink interface on it and provide an action to open hyperlink similarly like we do longdesc attribute on img element.

Thoughts?
comments.author: surkov.alexander@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Extra action is exposed on img accessible that has longdesc attribute, if AT invokes that action then we open a window with URI pointed by longdesc. I thought something like this we could implement for cite attribute on quote elements.

Mozilla had bugs asking to implement visual presentation of @cite attribute but they were closed because HTML spec says nothing about that. I think we could file new bug for that, come with ideas and describe what that's important (that wasn't implemented for ages by no one browsers if I get right).
